criterion: Reward for accurately documenting that the patient has been taking losartan for about one month without side-effects (specifically no cough).
Reward for capturing the patient's home blood pressure monitoring: generally within agreed range with one elevated reading attributed to stress.
Reward for documenting that the patient takes atorvastatin 10 mg at night and reports no muscle aches or other adverse effects.
Reward for including the clinician’s counseling instructions: continue BP monitoring, report persistent changes, and ensure adequate medication supply when traveling to avoid refill issues.
Reward for listing current medications (losartan 50 mg, atorvastatin 10 mg) and active conditions (hypertension, hyperlipidemia) exactly as in chart without adding unrelated items.
Reward for overall completeness: note captures all major statements, decisions, and counseling points present in the transcript with no significant omissions.
Penalize for omission or distortion of any of the key transcript elements above (e.g., missing counseling, incorrect duration of losartan, wrong dosage, misreporting symptoms).
Penalize for fabrication of information not present or implied in the transcript or chart (e.g., new diagnoses, physical exam findings, additional medications, ROS entries).
Penalize for copying irrelevant chart data (family history, empty allergy lists, unrelated historical sections) that were not referenced or pertinent to the encounter.
